children.translated_text: Consciousness is the <s>Ātman</s>

body.translated_text: The Śiva Sūtra, First Awakening

children.text: * caitanyaṃ citkriyārūpaṃ śivasya paramasya yat || SivSV_1.1:1 ||
children.translated_text: * Consciousness, which is the form of awareness and action, is of the Supreme <s>Śiva</s>

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * svātantryam etad evātmā tato 'sau paramaḥ śivaḥ || SivSV_1.1:2 ||
body.translated_text: * This freedom itself is the <s>Ātman</s>, therefore He is the Supreme <s>Śiva</s>

body.text: * athavā ko 'yam ātmeti praṣṭ bodhayituṃ śiśūn || SivSV_1.1:3 ||
body.translated_text: * Or, who is this <s>Ātman</s>? To instruct the children,

body.text: * nātmā deho na ca prāṇo na manaḥ khaṃ na śūnyabhūḥ || SivSV_1.1:4 ||
body.translated_text: * The <s>Ātman</s> is not the body, nor the breath, nor the mind, nor space, nor the void realm

body.text: * kiṃtu caitanyam evātmety ādiṣṭaṃ parameṣṭhinā || SivSV_1.1:5 ||
body.translated_text: * But rather, consciousness itself is declared as the <s>Ātman</s> by the Supreme Lord

body.text: * atha caitanyam evaitad ātmā svābhāvikaṃ vapuḥ || SivSV_1.1:6 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, consciousness itself is this <s>Ātman</s>, its natural form

body.text: * viśeṣācodanād asya jagataś cety arūpiṇaḥ || SivSV_1.1:7 ||
body.translated_text: * Due to the specific prompting of this world, which is without form

body.text: * acetyamānaṃ kasyāpi vapuḥ kim api no bhavet || SivSV_1.1:8 ||
body.translated_text: * If not perceived, the form of anything would not exist at all

body.text: * cetyamānaṃ tu cidrūpatādātmyāc cinmayaṃ bhavet || SivSV_1.1:9 ||
body.translated_text: * When perceived, due to its identity with the form of consciousness, it becomes consciousness-filled
* Thus, by the doctrine spoken by <s>Śiva</s>, of the moving and unmoving selves

body.text: * caitanyam eva viśvasya svarūpaṃ pāramārthikam || SivSV_1.1:11 ||
body.translated_text: * Consciousness alone is the true nature of the universe in the ultimate sense

body.text: * nanv evaṃvidhaviśvasya caitanyaṃ ced vapus tadā || SivSV_1.1:12 ||
body.translated_text: * If such is the form of consciousness of the universe, then

body.text: * kathaṃ bandhasya sambandha iti śaṅkāṃ vyapohitum || SivSV_1.1:13 ||
body.translated_text: * How is the connection of bondage to be dispelled?
* praśleṣāśleṣapāṭhābhyāṃ sūtram āha maheśvaraḥ || SivSV_1.1:14 ||]
Knowledge is bondage

children.translated_text: * Ignorance is first, manifesting as the expansion of consciousness

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * ātmany anātmatājñānaṃ jñānaṃ punar anātmani || SivSV_1.2:2 ||
body.translated_text: * Knowledge of non-self in the self, and again knowledge in the non-self

body.text: * dehādāv ātmamānitvaṃ dvayam apy etad āṇavam || SivSV_1.2:3 ||
body.translated_text: * The identification of self with body, etc., both these are the atomic

body.text: * malaṃ svakalpitaṃ svasmin bandhaḥ svecchāvibhāvitaḥ || SivSV_1.2:4 ||
body.translated_text: * Impurity, self-imagined in oneself, bondage manifested by one's own will

body.text: * kim āṇavamalātmaiva bandho 'yaṃ nety udīryate || SivSV_1.2:5 ||]
body.translated_text: * kim āṇavamalātmaiva bandho 'yaṃ nety udīryate || SivSV_1.2:5 ||]
The group of origins is the body of <s>Kalā</s>

children.text: * yonir bhedaprathāhetur māyā vargas tadutthitaḥ || SivSV_1.3:1 ||
children.translated_text: * The origin is the cause of the spread of diversity, <s>Māyā</s> is the group arising from that

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* The collection of principles from <s>Kalā</s> to earth is of that nature
* The impurity called <s>Māyīya</s>, consisting of the spread of diverse knowledge

body.text: * kaleti kāyam āviśya paricchedakarī nṛṇām || SivSV_1.3:4 ||
body.translated_text: * Invading the body as <s>Kalā</s>, it creates limitations for men

body.text: * vyāpṛtiḥ puṇyapāpātmā śarīraṃ yasya tat punaḥ || SivSV_1.3:5 ||
body.translated_text: * Activity, consisting of merit and demerit, whose body is that again

body.text: * kārmaṃ ca malam etasmin dvaye bandho 'nuvartate || SivSV_1.3:6 ||
body.translated_text: * And the karmic impurity, in these two, bondage continues
* In the Recognition of the Lord, this triad of impurities is spoken
* The loss of freedom in consciousness, and the ignorance of freedom
* This dual atomic impurity, due to the theft of one's own form
* The spread of diverse knowledge right here, the <s>Māyīya</s>, gives birth and experience

body.text: * kartary abodhe kārmaṃ tu māyāśaktyaiva tat trayam || SivSV_1.3:11 ||
body.translated_text: * In the doer, ignorance is karmic; indeed, that triad is by the power of <s>Māyā</s>

body.text: * ity athaiṣāṃ malānāṃ tu bandhakatvaṃ nirūpyate || SivSV_1.3:12 ||]
body.translated_text: * ity athaiṣāṃ malānāṃ tu bandhakatvaṃ nirūpyate || SivSV_1.3:12 ||]
The foundation of knowledge is <s>Mātṛkā</s>

children.translated_text: * Incomplete, of another form, consisting of the spread of diverse knowledge

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* Composed of all residual karmic impressions, of auspicious and inauspicious nature

body.text: * trividhaṃ malam uktaṃ yat tad eva jñānam ucyate || SivSV_1.4:3 ||
body.translated_text: * The threefold impurity that is spoken of, that itself is called knowledge

body.text: * na so 'sti pratyayo loke yaḥ śabdānugamād ṛte || SivSV_1.4:4 ||
body.translated_text: * There is no cognition in the world apart from the following of sound

body.text: * anuviddham iva jñānaṃ sarvaṃ śabdena gamyate || SivSV_1.4:5 ||
body.translated_text: * As if pierced through, all knowledge is comprehended by sound

body.text: * ity uktanītyā jñānasya vividhasyāsya mātṛkā || SivSV_1.4:6 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, according to the stated doctrine, the <s>Mātṛkā</s> of this manifold knowledge
* Composed of the fifty letters from 'a' to 'kṣa'
* The source of the assembly of principles from <s>Śiva</s> to earth
* Situated in the center of the skull, holding the noose of <s>Brahma</s>
* The terrifying goddesses of the seats, they delude again and again
* Thus, according to the doctrine spoken for the dispelling of the darkness of ignorance
* Perfected by the wheel of mothers presiding over the group of vowels and consonants

body.text: * apūrṇo 'ham ahaṃ pūrṇo 'haṃ kṛśo 'haṃ kṛśetaraḥ || SivSV_1.4:13 ||
body.translated_text: * I am incomplete, I am complete, I am thin, I am not thin
* Thus, through the piercing by sound, the cause of sorrow, joy, and so forth
* The foundation and the ruler, from that foundation for men
* Without attaining inward repose in one's own self continuously
* Outward-directed knowledges are said to be the causes of bondage
* Now, the means to calm the connection of such bondage is spoken
* paramopeyaviśrāntisatattvaḥ parameṣṭhinā || SivSV_1.4:19 ||]
Effort is <s>Bhairava</s>

children.translated_text: * This, of the nature of reflection, of the expanding self-awareness

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* Suddenly rising, having the nature of the emergence of intuition
* Effort is the inner vibration, of the nature of the full 'I' awareness

body.text: * sa eva sarvaśaktīnāṃ sāmarasyād aśeṣataḥ || SivSV_1.5:4 ||
body.translated_text: * That alone, from the harmony of all powers, completely
* Pervading the universe, of the differentiating thoughts

body.text: * alaṃ kavalanenāpīty anvarthād eva bhairavaḥ || SivSV_1.5:6 ||
body.translated_text: * Sufficient without engulfing, thus truly <s>Bhairava</s>
* Now, such attainment of <s>Bhairava</s> is the cause of the dispelling of bondage

body.text: * vyutthānaṃ ca bhavec chāntabhedābhāsam itīryate || SivSV_1.5:8 ||]
body.translated_text: * vyutthānaṃ ca bhavec chāntabhedābhāsam itīryate || SivSV_1.5:8 ||]
In the union of the wheel of powers, the dissolution of the universe

children.text: * yo 'yam uktaḥ svasaṃvitter udyamo bhairavātmakaḥ || SivSV_1.6:1 ||
children.translated_text: * This effort, said to be of the nature of <s>Bhairava</s> in self-awareness

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* It has great power, surpassing sequence and order
* Eager for the complete traversing of its own wheel of consciousness powers
* Appearing as both full and empty, yet beyond those forms, supreme
* By which, indeed, on the canvas of one's own consciousness, from the initial illumination of the knowable
* Ending in the repose of the supreme knower, having the form of vibration
* From the expansion of the power of creation, maintenance, and dissolution, known as manifestation
* The fivefold action, vibrating in the realm of manifestation, is expressed

body.text: * tayā prasāritasyāsya śakticakrasya yat punaḥ || SivSV_1.6:9 ||
body.translated_text: * By that, of this expanded wheel of powers, whatever again
* The union, in the internal tradition, reflection on the taught sequence

body.text: * tasmin saty asya viśvasya kālāgnyādikalāvadheḥ || SivSV_1.6:11 ||
body.translated_text: * In that truth, of this universe, up to the limit of time, fire, and other principles
* Dissolution would be characterized by the presence of the fire of self-awareness
* Thus, for the yogi whose differentiation is burned by the fire of self-awareness

body.text: * na syāt samādhivyutthānabhedaḥ ko 'pīti kathyate || SivSV_1.6:14 ||
body.translated_text: * It is said that there is no difference between samādhi and emergence
* In the difference of waking, dreaming, and deep sleep, the experience of the fourth arises

body.text: * udyamo bhairava iti proktarūpaṃ sphuradvapuḥ || SivSV_1.6:16 ||
body.translated_text: * Effort, said to be <s>Bhairava</s>, the form that shines forth

body.text: * turyaṃ nāma paraṃ dhāma tadābhogaś camatkriyā || SivSV_1.6:17 ||
body.translated_text: * The fourth, named the supreme abode, its experience is delight

body.text: * bhede 'pi jāgradādīnāṃ yoginas tasya sambhavaḥ || SivSV_1.6:18 ||
body.translated_text: * Even in the difference of waking and so on, for the yogi, that arises

body.text: * anusyūtiḥ parānandarūpā syād iti śiṣyate || SivSV_1.6:19 ||
body.translated_text: * The continuous flow, of the form of supreme bliss, thus remains
* jāgradāditrayaṃ sūtratrayeṇa lakṣyate kramāt || SivSV_1.6:20 ||]
Knowledge is waking
Dream is thoughts
Non-discrimination is <s>Māyā</s>, deep sleep

children.translated_text: * Knowledge arising from external senses is waking, pertaining to common objects

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * svapnaḥ svātmaiva samprokto vikalpāḥ svātmasambhavāḥ || SivSV_1.9:2 ||
body.translated_text: * Dream is said to be the self, thoughts arising from the self

body.text: * aviveko nijākhyātir māyā mohas tadātmakaḥ || SivSV_1.9:3 ||
body.translated_text: * Non-discrimination is one's own ignorance, <s>Māyā</s>, delusion is of that nature

body.text: * sauṣuptaṃ yoginām etat tritayaṃ dhāraṇādikam || SivSV_1.9:4 ||
body.translated_text: * For yogis, this triad is deep sleep, concentration, and so forth
* In the Recognition of the Lord, waking and so on are also indicated
* In the void, in the absence of intellect, etc., in the state of 'I' and doership
* The voidness of knowledge is only the impression of indistinct forms

body.text: * sākṣāṇām āntarī vṛttiḥ prāṇādiprerikā matā || SivSV_1.9:8 ||
body.translated_text: * The internal activity of the senses is considered to be driven by <s>Prāṇa</s> and others
* Or, life is said to be in <s>Prāṇa</s>, the 'I' is composed of the puryaṣṭaka

body.text: * tāvan mātrasthitau proktaṃ sauṣuptaṃ pralayopamam || SivSV_1.9:10 ||
body.translated_text: * In that state of mere existence, deep sleep is said to be like dissolution
* With and without objects of knowledge, united and disunited with <s>Māyā</s> impurity
* Even on the path of mind alone, due to the illusion as an object of the senses

body.text: * spaṣṭāvabhāsā bhāvānāṃ sṛṣṭiḥ svapnapadaṃ matam || SivSV_1.9:13 ||
body.translated_text: * The clear manifestation of states is considered the creation in the state of dream

body.text: * sarvākṣagocaratvena yā tu bāhyatayā sthirā || SivSV_1.9:14 ||
body.translated_text: * That which is stable externally, being the object of all senses

body.text: * sṛṣṭiḥ sādhāraṇī sarvapramātṇāṃ sa jāgaraḥ || SivSV_1.9:15 ||
body.translated_text: * The common creation of all knowers, that is waking
* Thus, it is extensively explained according to worldly suitability
* In this triad of waking and so forth, by attentiveness, be awake
* From the union of the wheel of powers, the cause of the dissolution of the universe
* The experience of the fourth, the knowledge of non-duality, dispelling ignorance

body.text: * sphuraty avirataṃ yasya sa taddhārādhirohataḥ || SivSV_1.9:20 ||
body.translated_text: * For whom it shines continuously, he ascends to that state
* turyātītamayaṃ yogī proktacaitanyam āmṛśan || SivSV_1.9:21 ||]
The enjoyer of the triad is <s>Vīreśa</s>

children.translated_text: * The triad of waking and so forth is connected with the union of the wheel of powers

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* Immersed in the essence of the bliss of the fourth, free from differentiation
* Immersed in the essence of bliss, contemplating the supreme space

body.text: * tritayasyāsya yo bhoktā camatkartā sa yogirāṭ || SivSV_1.10:4 ||
body.translated_text: * The one who is the enjoyer of this triad, the wonderer, he is the king of yogis

body.text: * triṣu dhāmasu yad bhogyaṃ bhoktā yaś ca prakīrtitaḥ || SivSV_1.10:5 ||
body.translated_text: * In the three states, what is to be enjoyed and who is the enjoyer is declared

body.text: * vidyāt tad ubhayaṃ yas tu sa bhuñjāno na lipyate || SivSV_1.10:6 ||
body.translated_text: * He who knows both, while enjoying, is not tainted
* Thus, the unchallenged majesty of the empire of consciousness is declared
* Dense with consciousness, full of supreme bliss of self-knowledge
* <s>Vīreśa</s> by whom the heroes who devour differentiation
* The lord of the senses, extending inwardly and outwardly
* What are the indications of his rest in the supreme consciousness state?

body.text: * bhūmikāḥ santy ayaṃ yābhir yāti sarvottarāṃ sthitim || SivSV_1.10:12 ||
body.translated_text: * The stages by which he attains the supreme state exist
* ity antevāsihṛcchaṅkāśāntyai santīty udīryate || SivSV_1.10:13 ||]
Wonder is the stages of <s>Yoga</s>

children.text: * yathā sātiśayānande kasyacid vismayo bhavet || SivSV_1.11:1 ||
children.translated_text: * As in the extreme bliss, wonder may arise for someone

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* So for this yogi, in the constant observation of various knowables
* Experiencing extraordinary supreme bliss, with senses stilled

body.text: * pare svātmany atṛptyaiva yad āścaryaṃ sa vismayaḥ || SivSV_1.11:4 ||
body.translated_text: * In the supreme self, through dissatisfaction itself, what wonder is that wonder

body.text: * sa eva khalu yogasya paratattvaikyarūpiṇaḥ || SivSV_1.11:5 ||
body.translated_text: * That indeed is the wonder of <s>Yoga</s>, of the form of unity with the supreme reality
* The stages indicating the ascent and supreme rest
* īrdṛgvismayavadyogabhūmikārūḍhacetasaḥ || SivSV_1.11:7 ||]
Will is the power, <s>Umā</s> the maiden

children.translated_text: * For the one who has attained the eternal state of <s>Parabhairava</s> through reasoning

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * tasyaiva yogino yecchā śaktiḥ saiva bhavaty umā || SivSV_1.12:2 ||
body.translated_text: * For that yogi, whose will is power, that indeed becomes <s>Umā</s>

body.text: * parā bhaṭṭārikā saiva kumārīti prakīrtitā || SivSV_1.12:3 ||
body.translated_text: * The supreme goddess, she is called the maiden
* Through the play of creation of the universe, from <s>Sadāśiva</s> to the end of the earth

body.text: * kumārī kuṃ mahāmāyābhūmiṃ mārayatīty api || SivSV_1.12:5 ||
body.translated_text: * The maiden, who slays the realm of great delusion, is also
* The maiden also is the enjoyment of this yogi, of the nature of <s>Bhairava</s>

body.text: * kumārī nānyabhogyā ca bhoktraikātmyena tiṣṭhati || SivSV_1.12:7 ||
body.translated_text: * The maiden is not for another's enjoyment and remains in unity with the enjoyer
* <s>Umā</s>, the maiden, having abandoned all attachments, of the great lord

body.text: * ārādhanaparā tadvad icchā śaktis tu yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.12:9 ||
body.translated_text: * Devoted to worship, likewise, the will is the power of the yogi

body.text: * ayam eva sphuṭaḥ pāṭho dṛṣṭo 'nuttaradaiśikaiḥ || SivSV_1.12:10 ||
body.translated_text: * This very clear reading is seen by the teachers of the highest truth

body.text: * vyākhyātaś ca paraiḥ śaktitametipaṭhanāt punaḥ || SivSV_1.12:11 ||
body.translated_text: * And explained by others, from repeated reading of the power
* The excellence of that power is revealed, consisting of knowledge and action
* evam īdṛkprabhāvecchāśaktiyuktasya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.12:13 ||]
The visible is the body

children.text: * yad yad dṛśyam aśeṣaṃ tac charīraṃ tasya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.13:1 ||
children.translated_text: * Whatever is visible, all of it is the body of that yogi

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * aham ity apṛthaktvena pativat pratibhāsanāt || SivSV_1.13:2 ||
body.translated_text: * Appearing as non-separate like a husband, as 'I'
* The body, devoid of body, mind, breath, like a pot and so on

body.text: * dṛśyam evāsya paśuvat draṣṭṛtvena na bhāsate || SivSV_1.13:4 ||
body.translated_text: * The visible does not appear to him as the seer, like an animal

body.text: * evaṃ dehe ca bāhye ca sarvatraivāsya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.13:5 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, in the body and outside, everywhere for this yogi
* The understanding is non-differentiated, like the essence of a peacock's egg

body.text: * dṛśyaṃ śarīratām eti śarīraṃ cāpi dṛśyatām || SivSV_1.13:7 ||
body.translated_text: * The visible becomes the body and the body becomes visible

body.text: * ity uktaṃ yogino yat tan na durghaṭam itīryate || SivSV_1.13:8 ||
body.translated_text: * What is said for the yogi, that is not impossible, it is stated
* From the conjunction of mind in the heart, the vision of the visible and the void

body.text: * hṛdayaṃ tad vijānīyād viśvasyāyatanaṃ mahat || SivSV_1.13:10 ||
body.translated_text: * Know that heart as the great abode of the universe
* Thus, according to the stated doctrine, the heart is the resting ground of the universe

body.text: * svasaṃvit tatra saṃghaṭṭaś cittasya calataḥ sataḥ || SivSV_1.13:12 ||
body.translated_text: * There, the conjunction of the moving mind with self-awareness
* The nature of wakefulness from the reflection on that unity
* Therefore, of the visible universe, having the form of blue bodies and so on
* The vision of the absence of this, of the void as well

body.text: * svāṅgarūpeṣu bhāveṣu pramātā kathyate patiḥ || SivSV_1.13:16 ||
body.translated_text: * In the forms of one's own body, the knower is called the lord

body.text: * iti śrīpratyabhijñoktanītyā patyur iva prabhoḥ || SivSV_1.13:17 ||
body.translated_text: * Thus, according to the doctrine of the Recognition of the Lord, like the lord
* The manifestation as his own limbs should occur as it is

body.text: * ukte 'py evaṃ prameye 'sminn upāyāntaram ucyate || SivSV_1.13:19 ||]
body.translated_text: * ukte 'py evaṃ prameye 'sminn upāyāntaram ucyate || SivSV_1.13:19 ||]
From union with the pure principle, the power of the bound soul

children.text: * śuddhaṃ tattvaṃ paraṃ vastu yat tat paraśivātmakam || SivSV_1.14:1 ||
children.translated_text: * The pure principle, the supreme reality, which is of the nature of <s>Paraśiva</s>

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:
* Its union is the contemplation of the universe as being that

body.text: * tenaiva yasya paśvākhyā bandhaśaktir na vidyate || SivSV_1.14:3 ||
body.translated_text: * By that alone, whose binding power called 'animal' does not exist

body.text: * tat sadāśivavatso 'pi viśvasya jagataḥ patiḥ || SivSV_1.14:4 ||
body.translated_text: * That one, like <s>Sadāśiva</s>, is also the lord of the universe
* śuddhatattvānusaṃdhānavata evāsya yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.14:5 ||]
Reasoning is self-knowledge

children.translated_text: * Reasoning is for the yogi whose bondage is destroyed by the declared union

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * viśvātmā śiva evāham asmīty arthavicintanam || SivSV_1.15:2 ||
body.translated_text: * The contemplation of the meaning, 'I am <s>Śiva</s>, the soul of the universe'

body.text: * etad eva sphuradrūpam ātmano jñānam ucyate || SivSV_1.15:3 ||
body.translated_text: * This very shining form is called self-knowledge
* kiṃ cāsya proktavaitarkasvātmavijñānaśālinaḥ || SivSV_1.15:4 ||]
Worldly bliss is the happiness of <s>Samādhi</s>

children.text: * lokyaṃ lokayitā ceti lokaś cetyacidātmani || SivSV_1.16:1 ||
children.translated_text: * The seen and the seer, thus the world, in the conscious self

body.translated_text: * Commentary on the Śiva Sūtra:

body.text: * tattadrūpatayā tasmiṃ loke sphurati yoginaḥ || SivSV_1.16:2 ||
body.translated_text: * In that world, it shines in various forms for the yogi
* The perception of the object and subject is common to all embodied beings

body.text: * yogināṃ tu viśeṣo 'yaṃ sambandhe sāvadhānatā || SivSV_1.16:4 ||
